{"step_by_step_thinking": "Dried blood spots test is a type of newborn screening test. It is not used to determine blood group, total cell count, or levels of creatinine and bilirubin. Instead, it is used to screen for certain metabolic disorders that are present from birth, also known as inborn errors of metabolism. These disorders often affect the body's ability to break down certain nutrients, and early detection can help prevent serious health problems.", "answer_choice": "A"}
